meanings.sent1: After a short nap, she will reawake feeling refreshed.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, I reawake to the sound of birds chirping outside.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock decided to reawake her from her peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun seemed to reawake the sleepy town from its nighttime slumber.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise outside made it impossible for him not to reawake from his sleep.

meanings.sent1: If you fall asleep during the movie, I will reawake you when it's over.
meanings.sent2: She tends to reawake in the middle of the night feeling thirsty.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies made her reawake with a sudden craving.
meanings.sent4: The loud thunderstorm made the entire household reawake in fear.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise outside made it impossible for him not to reawake from his sleep.

meanings.definition: To rouse from sleep or inactivity
meanings.sent1: The loud knock on the door managed to reawake the entire household.
meanings.sent2: The coach's motivational speech was enough to reawake the team's fighting spirit.
meanings.sent3: The smell of bacon cooking in the kitchen reawake the hungry teenager from his nap.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected phone call managed to reawake her interest in the project.
meanings.sent5: The sudden burst of laughter in the room reawake the drowsy student from his daydream.
